headline: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Scott Wiener

abstract: The April 28, 2023, episode of “The Ezra Klein Show.”

headline: ‘The Most Dangerous Person in the World Is Randi Weingarten’
snippet: School closures and culture wars turned classrooms into battlegrounds — and made the head of one of the country’s largest teachers’ unions a lightning rod for criticism.
abstract: School closures and culture wars turned classrooms into battlegrounds — and made the head of one of the country’s largest teachers’ unions a lightning rod for criticism.

headline: And in This Corner, Hailing From Dagestan, Presenting Hasbulla
snippet: A charismatic viral video star who stands just over three feet tall has become the most beloved man in the U.F.C. universe — even though he doesn’t actually fight.
abstract: A charismatic viral video star who stands just over three feet tall has become the most beloved man in the U.F.C. universe — even though he doesn’t actually fight.

headline: ‘White House Plumbers’ Revisits the Fringes of Watergate
snippet: A new HBO “slapstick tragedy” mostly avoids the Oval Office in favor of the men who actually executed the infamous burglary that brought down a president.
abstract: A new HBO “slapstick tragedy” mostly avoids the Oval Office in favor of the men who actually executed the infamous burglary that brought down a president.

headline: The Pillow Guy and the R.N.C. Chair
snippet: Conversations with Mike Lindell and Ronna McDaniel reveal the complexities of the divisions at the heart of the G.O.P.
abstract: Conversations with Mike Lindell and Ronna McDaniel reveal the complexities of the divisions at the heart of the G.O.P.

headline: Who’s to Blame for a Million Deaths?
snippet: While fingers are pointed at Trump and Fauci, the virus was an unbeaten foe.
abstract: While fingers are pointed at Trump and Fauci, the virus was an unbeaten foe.

headline: Biden’s Quiet Re-election Strategy
snippet: As Biden starts his campaign, we ask why he doesn’t spend more time in the public eye.
abstract: As Biden starts his campaign, we ask why he doesn’t spend more time in the public eye.

headline: Biden’s 2024 Campaign Begins. You Might Miss It at First.
snippet: The president has no immediate plans to barnstorm key states with large rallies. He will instead try to burnish his record, and hope Republican infighting continues.
abstract: The president has no immediate plans to barnstorm key states with large rallies. He will instead try to burnish his record, and hope Republican infighting continues.
byline: By Reid J. Epstein and Shane Goldmacher

headline: Your Wednesday Briefing: Biden’s Re-Election Bid
